channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AT&Tâ€™s stock rises as earnings bring beats on these two key numbers
item.description: AT&T topped expectations on postpaid phone subscriber growth and free cash flow for the second quarter.

item.title: World shatters heat record for the second time in just two days
item.description: The world registered its hottest day on record for the second time in just two days, according to the latest data compiled by the EU's climate monitor.

item.title: World shatters heat record for the second time in just two days
item.description: The world registered its hottest day on record for the second time in just two days, according to the latest data compiled by the EU's climate monitor.

item.title: The lesson from 17 first cuts of the cycle are more sobering for the stock market than it appears
item.description: The stock market usually goes up after the first cut, but the reason why might not be as helpful this time around.

item.title: How Truth Social could make former President Trump billions before turning a profit
item.description: Truth Social, a social platform formed by former President Trump, is poised to enrich early backers if its stock price stays elevated before the 2024 election.

item.title: World's largest luxury group LVMH slumps 4% after second-quarter revenue miss
item.description: Shares in LVMH fell on Wednesday after the luxury group on Tuesday released its earnings for the first half of 2024.

item.title: Gen Xâ€™s retirement woes may give rise to a generation of â€˜silver squattersâ€™
item.description: This generation will need more financial and housing support from family than older generations, study says.

item.title: Scientists discover â€˜dark oxygenâ€™ being produced by seabed metals in ground-breaking study
item.description: A team of scientists has discovered that oxygen is being produced by metallic nodules thousands of meters below the surface of the Pacific Ocean.

item.title: Spain's Santander posts 20% hike in net profit as retail business shines
item.description: Banco Santander posted a 20% year-on-year hike in second-quarter net profit underpinned by growth in its retail, wealth and consumer activity.

item.title: LVMH shares slump on signs the post-COVID luxury boom is over
item.description: The luxury conglomerate posted a 1% drop in its second quarter revenue after its sales previously boomed last year in the aftermath of the COVID-19 pandemic

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield dips as investors closely monitor economic data
item.description: Treasury yields slipped on Wednesday as investors looked ahead to a fresh batch of economic data and considered the outlook for the U.S. economy.

item.title: Nasdaq futures fall after Alphabet, Tesla report earnings: Live updates
item.description: Nasdaq-100 futures traded lower Wednesday as investors were underwhelmed by quarterly reports from megacap tech companies Alphabet and Tesla.

item.title: German manufacturing slumps, eurozone economy listless in July
item.description: Political deadlock in France and a prolonged slump in German manufacturing continue to dog economic activity in the eurozone, according to surveys published Wednesday.

item.title: World logs hottest day since records began â€” with fresh highs expected in the coming months
item.description: The world's average temperature on Sunday climbed to its highest level ever recorded, according to the European Union's climate monitor.

item.title: Deutsche Bank shares drop 6% after lender snaps 15-quarter profit streak
item.description: Net loss attributable to shareholders was 143 million euros ($155.1 million), against an LSEG poll of analysts which had predicted a loss of 145 million euros.
